metadata.title: CVE-2021-2179 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Group Replication Plugin). Supported versions that are affected are5.7.33 and prior and 8.0.23 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerabilityallows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocolsto compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.9 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2179` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-client - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-router - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-server - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.25-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.25-0ubuntu3').
